items.sentence: Maybe something happened to change Tom\'s plans.
Tom said he was ready to face a tough challenge.
Tom said he wished he could speak French better.
French is the only foreign language I can speak.
French is the only language I know how to speak.
Get in touch with me as soon as you arrive here.
Go and talk to her, Tom. What are you afraid of?
Tom keeps an eagle feather as a good-luck charm.
Tom kept his true feelings hidden from everyone.
The lad leaned over and shouted into Tom\'s ear.
Tom called the office to say that he\'d be late.
Tom hasn\'t eaten anything in the past 36 hours.
Tom hasn\'t yet told us what he wants us to buy.
The moment she was alone, she opened the letter.
I wouldn\'t want to do anything against the law.
I know we can\'t count on Tom to do that for us.
About how long do you think the meeting will be?
I\'ll never forget the last time that I met Tom.
Tom noticed Mary the moment he entered the room.
Tom practices the piano about three hours a day.
Tom regrets having told Mary about the incident.
Tom is living in a cockroach-infested apartment.
Tom is so fat he needs two seats on an airplane.
The problem is that Tom doesn\'t have any money.
I had no idea you knew how to play the trombone.
I had no idea you were planning to go to Boston.
I had some time to think about what I had to do.
I had the feeling you were going to ask me that.
Tom asked me what I thought was going to happen.
Would you go to Boston if you had the chance to?
Tom can\'t play the piano as well as he used to.
Tom can\'t write French without making mistakes.
We played basketball and then went to the beach.
We realize now that Tom never really liked Mary.
We started celebrating as soon as Tom showed up.
Have any of your friends ever been to Australia?
Tom doesn\'t need to worry about that happening.
Tom doesn\'t really enjoy hanging out with Mary.
Tom doesn\'t remember where he put his passport.
Something seems to have caught Tom\'s attention.
Sorry, I\'m 30 minutes late because I overslept.
Speaking a foreign language well isn\'t so easy.
I still have three hours before my plane leaves.
I stuck two sheets of paper together with paste.
I think we can do this better than we have been.
I think we should speak to each other in French.
Can\'t you stay in Boston until at least Monday?
We wouldn\'t stand a chance against Tom\'s gang.
Why do we learn so much useless stuff in school?
Why do you suppose all this is happening to you?
